VIII.i.2.B.2.e
.
Handling Claims for a Covered Disease That Do Not Specifically Mention Herbicide Exposure
Under a February 11, 1999, order by the District Court, a claim for disability compensation or DIC that is received from a
Nehmer
class member for a covered disease does not have to specifically mention herbicide exposure or assert that the condition was caused by exposure to herbicides in order to qualify as a
Nehmer
claim.
title: M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section B - Determining Eligibility to Retroactive Payment Under the Nehmer Stipulation
